actions.args: {"id": 97, "body": {"name": "Travel Stipend [REDACTED] Movement - Bangkok, Nov. 2024", "summary": "As a contributor to the NEAR ecosystem from the very beginning, with my own experiments and to the DevHUB platform, I very much look forward to meet all the great people that I\\\\\\'m hacking together with on these projects every day. Also I have submitted the JsInRust+NearOpenAI proejct for the hackaton, and a speaker proposal for it as well ( including WebAssembly Music too ). For me being at Redacted Bangkok will have great value, and I hope also for others to meet me as well. ", "category": "Bounty", "timeline": {"status": "DRAFT"}, "supervisor": "yarotska.near", "description": "# Purpose\\\\nI am applying for the overseas travel stipend of $1,575 to attend the [REDACTED] hackathon in Bangkok, Thailand.\\\\n\\\\n# My Records\\\\nI got involved into the NEAR ecosystem after my talk \\\\\\\"WebAssembly Music\\\\\\\" at the WebAssembly Summit 2020 ( https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=C8j_ieOm4vE ), where the idea of music published in tiny WebAssembly files was launched. I made a proof of this by publishing the first music NFT on NEAR https://x.com/salomonsen_p/status/1369699664908410885, which also then lead me to NEARCON 2021 for speaking about the project https://youtu.be/2OgeSuACr2c?si=EjzDIPgkhml9HlHh\\\\n\\\\nAfter this I\\\\\\'ve had various projects on NEAR including the JSinRust project for combining the standard Rust smart contracts with Javascript for customizing. This is also the hackaton project that I\\\\\\'ve submitted https://devpost.com/software/jsinrust-nearopenai\\\\n\\\\nAnother project I\\\\\\'ve spent much time for, with the main purpose of tax reporting of income on NEAR is the Ariz Portfolio: https://arizportfolio.near.page/\\\\n\\\\nI am also a contributor to the DevHUB platform, and very much looking forward to meet my fellow contributors.\\\\n\\\\n# Travel itinerary and costs\\\\nI\\\\\\'m traveling from Sandefjord, Norway, flying directly from Oslo, Norway to Bangkok.\\\\n\\\\nI\\\\\\'ve already booked and paid for flight and hotel, so these are my expenses so far:\\\\n\\\\nEUR 1 076,01 = 1,169 USD ( 2024-10-12 )\\\\nNOK 4366,24 = 406 USD ( 2024-10-12 )\\\\n\\\\n**Total 1,575 USD**\\\\n\\\\n# Project plan\\\\nI am planning to hack on the JSInRust+NEAROpenAI project which you can read more about here: https://devpost.com/software/jsinrust-nearopenai\\\\n\\\\nI am also hoping to be able to present updates on the WebAssembly music project, the Ariz portfolio project and talk about what we\\\\\\'re hacking on with the DevHUB platform.", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "petersalomonsen.near", "requested_sponsor": "events-committee.near", "proposal_body_version": "V0", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "1000", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDC"}, "labels": ["Travel expenses"]}

{"data": {"events-committee.near": {"index": {"notify": "{\\\\\\\"key\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"petersalomonsen.near\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"value\\\\\\\":{\\\\\\\"type\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"proposal/edit\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"proposal\\\\\\\":97,\\\\\\\"widgetAccountId\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"events-committee.near\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"notifier\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"petersalomonsen.near\\\\\\\"}}"}}}}

{"data": {"events-committee.near": {"index": {"notify": "{\\\\\\\"key\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"petersalomonsen.near\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"value\\\\\\\":{\\\\\\\"type\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"proposal/edit\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"proposal\\\\\\\":97,\\\\\\\"widgetAccountId\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"events-committee.near\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"notifier\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"petersalomonsen.near\\\\\\\"}}"}}}}

{"body": {"name": "Requesting Travel Stipend for [REDACTED] Movement", "summary": "Hi there! We\\\\u{2019}re Team ValidAI, a group of five students from IIT Roorkee, India, and we\\\\u{2019}re excited about attending the upcoming [REDACTED] hackathon in Bangkok. We recently built a decentralized AI project at ETHGlobal Singapore, and we\\\\u{2019}re now looking for some support to cover our flight costs to Bangkok. We will try to manage all other expenses like food ourselves.\\\\n", "category": "Bounty", "timeline": {"status": "DRAFT"}, "supervisor": null, "description": "#  **Introduction**\\\\nOur team created ValidAI, a decentralized AI marketplace, during ETHGlobal Singapore. The platform helps developers access pre-trained AI models for tasks like smart contract auditing, RAG agents and more while allowing AI/ML researchers to earn money when others use their models. We built this on NEAR Protocol, taking advantage of its low fees and secure environment.\\\\n\\\\nMy Team has made individual posts and are conditionally approved :\\\\n[https://near.social/events-committee.near/widget/app?page=proposal&id=79](https://near.social/events-committee.near/widget/app?page=proposal&id=79)\\\\n\\\\n# **Purpose**\\\\nWe are passionate about improving ValidAI and contributing to the NEAR ecosystem. We feel there is a lot of scope of improvement and a lot of scope in the project to create real world value. The Bangkok hackathon is a great opportunity for us to take our project to the next level, learn more, and engage with the community. It will also help us reach the vision we have for this project.\\\\n\\\\n# **Request for Travel Stipend**\\\\n We\\\\u{2019}re just asking for help with our flights to Bangkok, which costs $350 per person. We would love to work at a NEAR Hackerhouse if there is such a provision. If not we would request upto $200 per person for accommodation. We\\\\u{2019}re not requesting any additional funds for food, or other expenses\\\\u{2014}we\\\\u{2019}ll handle those on our own.\\\\n\\\\nDeparture: Delhi, India \\\\u{2192} Bangkok, Thailand\\\\nReturn: Bangkok, Thailand \\\\u{2192} Delhi, India\\\\n\\\\n# **Estimated breakdown:**\\\\nFlight cost per person: $350\\\\nAccommodation cost per person: $200\\\\nTeam size: 5 students\\\\nRequest per student: $500 (Capping according to the T&C)\\\\n\\\\n# **About Our Project: ValidAI**\\\\nValidAI is a decentralized AI marketplace that connects developers and researchers. Developers can use AI models for tasks like auditing smart contracts, while AI/ML researchers earn through a subscription-based model when their models are used. We\\\\u{2019}ve built it to be user-friendly, secure, and affordable, leveraging NEAR Protocol\\\\u{2019}s technology.\\\\n\\\\n# **Why We Need the Support**\\\\nAs students, we\\\\u{2019}re covering as much as we can ourselves, but the flight cost is a bit of a challenge. This travel stipend would make it possible for us to attend the hackathon and focus fully on developing our project and contributing to the NEAR ecosystem.\\\\n\\\\n# **Conclusion**\\\\nWe\\\\u{2019}re eager to attend the [REDACTED] hackathon in Bangkok and continue building on NEAR. Your support would mean a lot to us and help us cover the travel costs we need to participate. Thank you for considering our proposal.\\\\n\\\\nProject Link to ETH Global Submission: https://ethglobal.com/showcase/validai-kx6ou\\\\n\\\\nBest regards,\\\\nLakshya\\\\nTeam ValidAI", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "65cef53014c0eb6c9f046273bc4670921fec82d8fdc4ce8153f9231d4f589465", "requested_sponsor": "events-committee.near", "proposal_body_version": "V0", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "500", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDC"}, "labels": ["Travel expenses", "Hackathon"], "accepted_terms_and_conditions_version": 131583328}

{"data": {"events-committee.near": {"post": {"main": "{\\\\\\\"type\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"md\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"text\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"We have just received a new *Bounty* proposal.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n\\\\u{2014}\\\\u{2014}\\\\u{2014}\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**By**: @65cef53014c0eb6c9f046273bc4670921fec82d8fdc4ce8153f9231d4f589465\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**Title**: \\\\u{201c}Requesting Travel Stipend for [REDACTED] Movement\\\\u{201c}\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**Summary**:\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nHi there! We\\\\u{2019}re Team ValidAI, a group of five students from IIT Roorkee, India, and we\\\\u{2019}re excited about attending the upcoming [REDACTED] hackathon in Bangkok. We recently built a decentralized AI project at ETHGlobal Singapore, and we\\\\u{2019}re now looking for some support to cover our flight costs to Bangkok. We will try to manage all other expenses like food ourselves.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n\\\\u{2014}\\\\u{2014}\\\\u{2014}\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nRead the full proposal and share your feedback on [DevHub](/events-committee.near/widget/app?page=proposal&id=115)\\\\\\\"}"}, "index": {"post": "{\\\\\\\"key\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"main\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"value\\\\\\\":{\\\\\\\"type\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"md\\\\\\\"}}"}}}}

{"proposal": {"id": 115, "snapshot": {"name": "Requesting Travel Stipend for [REDACTED] Movement", "labels": ["Hackathon", "Travel expenses"], "summary": "Hi there! We\\\\u{2019}re Team ValidAI, a group of five students from IIT Roorkee, India, and we\\\\u{2019}re excited about attending the upcoming [REDACTED] hackathon in Bangkok. We recently built a decentralized AI project at ETHGlobal Singapore, and we\\\\u{2019}re now looking for some support to cover our flight costs to Bangkok. We will try to manage all other expenses like food ourselves.\\\\n", "category": "Bounty", "timeline": {"status": "DRAFT"}, "editor_id": "65cef53014c0eb6c9f046273bc4670921fec82d8fdc4ce8153f9231d4f589465", "timestamp": "1730327153731371233", "supervisor": null, "description": "#  **Introduction**\\\\nOur team created ValidAI, a decentralized AI marketplace, during ETHGlobal Singapore. The platform helps developers access pre-trained AI models for tasks like smart contract auditing, RAG agents and more while allowing AI/ML researchers to earn money when others use their models. We built this on NEAR Protocol, taking advantage of its low fees and secure environment.\\\\n\\\\nMy Team has made individual posts and are conditionally approved :\\\\n[https://near.social/events-committee.near/widget/app?page=proposal&id=79](https://near.social/events-committee.near/widget/app?page=proposal&id=79)\\\\n\\\\n# **Purpose**\\\\nWe are passionate about improving ValidAI and contributing to the NEAR ecosystem. We feel there is a lot of scope of improvement and a lot of scope in the project to create real world value. The Bangkok hackathon is a great opportunity for us to take our project to the next level, learn more, and engage with the community. It will also help us reach the vision we have for this project.\\\\n\\\\n# **Request for Travel Stipend**\\\\n We\\\\u{2019}re just asking for help with our flights to Bangkok, which costs $350 per person. We would love to work at a NEAR Hackerhouse if there is such a provision. If not we would request upto $200 per person for accommodation. We\\\\u{2019}re not requesting any additional funds for food, or other expenses\\\\u{2014}we\\\\u{2019}ll handle those on our own.\\\\n\\\\nDeparture: Delhi, India \\\\u{2192} Bangkok, Thailand\\\\nReturn: Bangkok, Thailand \\\\u{2192} Delhi, India\\\\n\\\\n# **Estimated breakdown:**\\\\nFlight cost per person: $350\\\\nAccommodation cost per person: $200\\\\nTeam size: 5 students\\\\nRequest per student: $500 (Capping according to the T&C)\\\\n\\\\n# **About Our Project: ValidAI**\\\\nValidAI is a decentralized AI marketplace that connects developers and researchers. Developers can use AI models for tasks like auditing smart contracts, while AI/ML researchers earn through a subscription-based model when their models are used. We\\\\u{2019}ve built it to be user-friendly, secure, and affordable, leveraging NEAR Protocol\\\\u{2019}s technology.\\\\n\\\\n# **Why We Need the Support**\\\\nAs students, we\\\\u{2019}re covering as much as we can ourselves, but the flight cost is a bit of a challenge. This travel stipend would make it possible for us to attend the hackathon and focus fully on developing our project and contributing to the NEAR ecosystem.\\\\n\\\\n# **Conclusion**\\\\nWe\\\\u{2019}re eager to attend the [REDACTED] hackathon in Bangkok and continue building on NEAR. Your support would mean a lot to us and help us cover the travel costs we need to participate. Thank you for considering our proposal.\\\\n\\\\nProject Link to ETH Global Submission: https://ethglobal.com/showcase/validai-kx6ou\\\\n\\\\nBest regards,\\\\nLakshya\\\\nTeam ValidAI", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "65cef53014c0eb6c9f046273bc4670921fec82d8fdc4ce8153f9231d4f589465", "requested_sponsor": "events-committee.near", "proposal_body_version": "V0", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "500", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDC"}, "author_id": "65cef53014c0eb6c9f046273bc4670921fec82d8fdc4ce8153f9231d4f589465", "snapshot_history": [], "social_db_post_block_height": "0"}}

{"body": {"name": "Travel Stipend [REDACTED] Movement - Bangkok, Nov. 2024", "summary": "We are Amira Nasri, a blockchain developer, and Walid Zaghdoudi, a cybersecurity engineer, contributing to the NEAR ecosystem. We seek a stipend to attend [REDACTED] in Bangkok, traveling from Tunisia. Our goal is to develop NEARGPTAI Dev Tools, which will integrate AI, chain abstraction, and enhanced security on the NEAR platform. This project aims to create scalable and secure tools that drive adoption and strengthen user trust. Attending this event will allow us to collaborate globally", "category": "Bounty", "timeline": {"status": "DRAFT"}, "supervisor": null, "description": "**Purpose**  \\\\nI am applying for an overseas travel stipend of $2000 to attend the [REDACTED] hackathon in Bangkok, Thailand.\\\\n\\\\n**My Records**  \\\\nAs a blockchain developer, I have actively organized workshops to teach NEAR technology in Tunisia, helping to educate and engage the local developer community. I also organized the AI Chain Near Tunisia hackathon and participated in NEARCON 2022 on Portugal, NEARCON IRL online.\\\\n[NEARCON IRL Hackathon](https://nearcon-hackathon.devpost.com/) : [Submission (https://devpost.com/software/elaco) \\\\n[AI Chain NEAR Tunisia Hackathon \\\\n](https://taikai.network/hackbox/hackathons/ai-chain-near-tunisia?token=Q05VQK5GBHLM8C8U)\\\\n\\\\n**Travel Itinerary and Estimated Costs**  \\\\n- **Departure:** Tunis, Tunisia \\\\u{2192} Bangkok, Thailand (5th November)  \\\\n- **Return:** Bangkok, Thailand \\\\u{2192} Tunis, Tunisia (14th November)\\\\n\\\\n**Estimated Costs Breakdown** (2 prs) \\\\n- **Flights:** $1700 USD  \\\\n- **Visa and Other Costs (Accommodation, Local Transport, etc.):** $300  \\\\n- **Total Estimated Cost:** $2000 USD  \\\\n\\\\n**Project Plan**  \\\\nAt the hackathon, Walid and I will develop **NEARGPTAI Dev Tools**, an AI-based project that aligns with the event\\\\\\'s submission criteria. Our goal is to integrate AI, chain abstraction, and enhanced security on the NEAR platform, creating scalable tools that enhance user trust and drive adoption. I will update this proposal once our project is submitted.\\\\n\\\\n**Project Submission**  \\\\n[Devpost Redacted Submission \\\\n](https://devpost.com/software/neargpt-ai-tools)\\\\n\\\\nI\\\\u{2019}m excited to attend this event and would greatly appreciate your support. We look forward to connecting with the NEAR community in Bangkok!\\\\n\\\\nBest,  \\\\nAmira Nasri", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "alae.near", "requested_sponsor": "events-committee.near", "proposal_body_version": "V0", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "2000", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDC"}, "labels": ["Hackathon", "Travel expenses"], "accepted_terms_and_conditions_version": 131633589}

We seek a stipend to attend [REDACTED] in Bangkok, traveling from Tunisia. Our goal is to develop NEARGPTAI Dev Tools, which will integrate AI, chain abstraction, and enhanced security on the NEAR platform. This project aims to create scalable and secure tools that drive adoption and strengthen user trust. Attending this event will allow us to collaborate globally\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n\\\\u{2014}\\\\u{2014}\\\\u{2014}\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nRead the full proposal and share your feedback on [DevHub](/events-committee.near/widget/app?page=proposal&id=116)\\\\\\\"}"}, "index": {"post": "{\\\\\\\"key\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"main\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"value\\\\\\\":{\\\\\\\"type\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"md\\\\\\\"}}"}}}}

{"body": {"name": "Travel stipend for Redacted 2024", "summary": "gm NEAR community! I\\\\\\'m a hacker and senior blockchain dev looking to attend Redacted in Bangkok.", "category": "Bounty", "timeline": {"status": "DRAFT"}, "supervisor": null, "description": "I am a senior smart contract developer, OSS and Linux contributor. I have over 10+ hackathon wins: Solana, NEAR, Chainlink and EthGlobal. I\\\\\\'m a member of Superteam India.\\\\n\\\\nNotable projects\\\\n  - NEAR hackathon winner (2021): NFT fractionalization on NEAR. https://github.com/secretshardul/fractose-contracts-v1\\\\n  - servicer.dev: Linux process management tool with 400 github stars and active community. https://github.com/servicer-labs/servicer\\\\n  - Icedancer (Solana Colosseum 2024 honorable mention): WASM based indexing protocol on Solana. https://github.com/icedancer-io/indexer-core\\\\n  - Golem photogrammetry ($5000 prize): Built a photogrammetry processing service on Golem\\\\\\'s decentralized cloud. https://github.com/secretshardul/golem-photogrammetry\\\\n  - Complete Shakespeare (2021): Built a search engine for Shakespeare on Dgraph\\\\\\'s graph database. https://github.com/secretshardul/complete-shakespeare\\\\n   - Complete Shakespeare (2021): Built a search engine for Shakespeare on Dgraph\\\\\\'s graph database. https://github.com/secretshardul/complete-shakespeare\\\\n  - Datastacks Astra hackathon (runner up, 2021): Built a VSCode extension for Astra\\\\\\'s cloud Cassandra database.  - Postman hackathon top 5 (2022): https://github.com/secretshardul/postcards-android\\\\n\\\\nI am requesting a stipend of $500 to cover expenses from India. Regards!", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "monkeyis.near", "requested_sponsor": "events-committee.near", "proposal_body_version": "V0", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "500", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDC"}, "labels": ["Travel expenses"], "accepted_terms_and_conditions_version": 131657184}

{"body": {"name": "Travel sponsorship for Redacted", "summary": "Hello Near community. I am a web3 enthusiast and developer from India. I\\\\\\'m asking for a travel grant of $500 to travel to the Redacted hackathon in Bangkok.", "category": "Bounty", "timeline": {"status": "DRAFT"}, "supervisor": null, "description": "I am a web3 enthusiast and blockchain developer in the making.\\\\n\\\\nSome of my works are\\\\n\\\\n- Stratum (proof of work token on Near): This is my submission to redacted. https://grand-sawine-1d648f.netlify.app/\\\\n- ETHSEA Finalist 2024- https://devfolio.co/projects/aptosphere-41d7\\\\n- Winner of the Near Global Citizens Bounty at ETHDenver & ColoradoJam (2021)\\\\nhttps://devfolio.co/projects/crypto-plants-save-the-planet-with-awesome-nfts-b065\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nCurrently I\\\\\\'m building Stratum. Stratum is a proof-of-work token distribution system built on the NEAR blockchain. Miners compete to find a hash-based proof for a counter stored in our smart contract. When a user submits a correct proof, the contract verifies it, rewards the user with a token, and increments the counter, prompting the next round. Mining is as simple as connecting your wallet and clicking \\\\\\\"Start Mining\\\\\\\"\\\\u{2014}the rest runs automatically.
